column4: I have Ubuntu 10.04 Desktop Edition (Normal Ubuntu), if I would like to change my Ubuntu to Ubuntu Netbook Remix Edition, can I?
open synaptic package manager    ,, hit search ,, tyep   netbook,,, you probably wanth the gnome one not the kubuntu one
I don't know :P I would like the Netbook edition which says in www.ubuntu.com (I would like to transform into that through upgrade process if possible).
yeah but with Netbook's User Interface
well my suggestion is not to upgrade to 11.04  but clean install,,, however ,, it really is not ready
well the similar interface in is ubuntu netbook edition but not sure if it is identical to the natty netbook Unity
can I transform my ubuntu into ubuntu netbook's edition and stay on 10.04 as I am now?
sure ,, just install the ubuntu-netbook   ,, I would google ubuntu 10.10  netbook screenshots to be sure its what you want
with  netbook and take a look at it
if your system is fairly  new  it should be able to handle it  otherwise  mutter,, the compositor will take up resources,,aka  a hog
or wait until the end of April for the release of ubuntu 11.04
I have Ubuntu 10.04 LTS now. An idea came into my mind today if I would be able to change my Ubuntu 10.04 to Ubuntu Netbook Edition 10.04 or 10.10. Anyway, I will search more and then decide. Thanks!
